snippet.title: Storytelling@TheLibrary: "Amber Heard: An Actress and Human Rights Activist”
snippet.description:
Recorded on 22 October 2018 at the United Nations Library at Geneva, by the UN Library at Geneva, by UNTV & the UN Library Geneva.
Amber Heard is a world-renowned actress and an outspoken advocate against discrimination. A Human Rights Champion for the UN Human Rights Office, she lends her voice and support to promote the principles of the Universal Declaration of Human Rights (UDHR), which remains as powerfully relevant today as when it was adopted in 1948. Amber devotes her time off-screen to organizations such as Amnesty International and Art of Elysium, and most recently returned from a humanitarian trip to Jordan to visit Syrian refugees.

Welcome Remarks: Sigrun Habermann, UN Library Geneva. Introductory Remarks: Laurent Sauveur (Chief, External Outreach Service, UN Human Rights Office). Moderated by: Thomas Neufing (Chief, UNOG Centre for Learning and Multilingualism (CLM), United Nations Office at Geneva).
